arm_group.description: Specimen Collection/Risk Factor Assessment -> Diet/Exercise -> Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock:
This clinical trial studies dietary and exercise interventions in preventing cardiovascular
      disease in younger survivors of leukemia, lymphoma, or brain tumors. Eating a healthy diet
      and exercising regularly may reduce the risk in preventing cardiovascular disease in younger
      survivors of leukemia, lymphoma, or brain tumors.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dietary and Exercise Interventions in Preventing Cardiovascular Disease in Younger Survivors of Leukemia, Lymphoma, or Brain Tumors

detailed_description.textblock:
To study the effect of lifestyle changes (dietary and physical activity) on cardiovascular
      risk factors (BMI, Waist circumference and blood pressure) in childhood survivors of
      leukemia, lymphoma and brain tumors 2. To study whether there is a difference between the
      response to intervention between the different types of cancers (leukemia vs. lymphoma vs.
      brain tumors), and to correlate response to disease 3. To determine the feasibility of
      lifestyle changes in this patient population 4. To assess adherence to changes in dietary
      and physical activity during the course of this planned intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  1. Diagnosis of leukemia, lymphoma, brain tumors

          -  2. At risk and medium risk patient

          -  3. Patients 3 months to 2 year after completion of therapy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  1. Patients who are already on antihypertensive or insulin or cholesterol lowering
             medication.

          -  2. High risk patient, as they will receive pharmaceutical intervention

          -  3. Other cancer diagnoses

intervention.description: Participants will be taught by a registered dietician about energy balance and how body weight relates to energy intake and expenditure, although specific calorie prescriptions will not be given. An exercise physiologist will create a personalized exercise plan and prescription which is tailored to his / her needs and current level of activity and fitness
intervention.intervention_name: Specimen Collection/Risk Factor Assessment -> Diet/Exercise -> Chemotherapy

facility.name: Virginia Commonwealth University, Massey Cancer Center

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Non-Pharmacologic Interventions on Risk Factors of Cardiovascular Disease in Survivors of Childhood Leukemia, Lymphoma and Brain Tumor

primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed via paired T test.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in weight, defined as a decrease in weight by 5-10% from the enrollment weight

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed via paired T test.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood pressure, defined as a decrease in systolic blood pressure by 4-8 mmHg from the blood pressure at enrollment

secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed via paired T test.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total cholesterol, defined as a decrease in total cholesterol by 5-7% from the level at time of enrollment

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
